title: S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) Analyst Rating Update
text:
Home » Analyst Views » S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) Analyst Rating Update S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) Analyst Rating Update on August 3, 2015 
Wall Street analysts polled by Zacks Research have given S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) a rating of 2.83 on a consensus basis. Using a simplified scale where 1 is a Strong Buy and 5 a Strong Sell, this is the average number of the 3 brokerages surveyed. The stock had a rating of 2.83 when analyst ratings were averaged three months ago. 
The covering analysts have a one year price objective of $31.666 on S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA). The most bullish brokerage firm sees the stock heading to $32 , while the most conservative estimate has an objective of $31. 
Earnings Look 
Wall Street will be paying close attention when S&T Bancorp, Inc. reports their next quarterly earnings report on 2015-10-27. Analysts polled by Zacks are expecting earnings per share of $0.56 for the period ending 2015-09-30. This is the consensus number based on the 3 broker predictions taken into consideration. On a longer term basis, sell-side analysts who project long term growth are expecting earnings of $N/A. This is the three to five year estimate for both earnings and sales. 
Most recently S&T Bancorp, Inc. reported actual earnings of $0.52 per share for the quarter ending on 2015-06-30. The actual reported number was $0.03 away from what analysts had expected, yielding a surprise factor of 6.12%. 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. (S&T) is a bank holding company and has three wholly owned subsidiaries, S&T Bank, 9th Street Holdings, Inc. and STBA Capital Trust I. The Company also owns certain interest in Commonwealth Trust Credit Life Insurance Company. As of December 31, 2012, the Company had approximately .4 billion in loans and .6 billion in deposits. S&T Bank is a full service bank. It provides its services to its customers through offices located in Allegheny, Armstrong, Blair, Butler, Cambria, Clarion, Clearfield, Indiana, Jefferson and Westmoreland counties of Pennsylvania. It operates in three segments: Community Banking, Wealth Management and Insurance. Its Community Banking segment offers services, which include accepting time and demand deposit accounts, originating commercial and consumer loans, and providing letters of credit and credit card services. The Wealth Management segment offers discount brokerage services, services as executor and trustee under wills and deeds.
